PrivacyObjectSession.name: PrivacyObjectSession
PrivacyObjectSession.description: Represents the status of each object being processed in past, ongoing, and scheduled policy jobs in Privacy Center.

CurrentEntity.description: The name of the object in the policy.

Name.description: Represents the job session record. This is a serialized, automatically generated number field.

ObjectFailureLog.description: This field is reserved for later use.

ObjectStatus.description: The policy execution status for the object.

OwnerId.description: The ID of the owner of the account associated with the customer that the policy was executed for.

PolicyNode.description: The ID of the object in the serialized policy. This field associates the object session in the policy execution with the coordinating object in the Privacy Center policy.

Position.description: Represents a recordâ€™s position in the batch queue for the object being processed.

PrivacyJobSessionObjectId.description: The ID of the policy job session.

ProcessType.description: The type of action being executed on the object in the policy.

ProcessedFailures.description: The number of records the policy execution failed to process.

ProcessedSuccesses.description: The number of records the policy execution successfully processed.

ProcessedTotal.description: The total number of records processed in the policy job.

Processor.description: The name of the deletion, masking, or traversal processor executing the policy job.

Queue.description: This field is reserved for later use.

QueueLength.description: The total number of records in the queue to be processed by the policy job.

RecordsAffected.description: The number of records processed by the policy job.

Retry.description: The queue number of the retry session after a failed policy execution attempt. Each attempt to retry the policy execution is put into a retry queue.

TraversalEndTime.description: The end time of the record-capturing phase for the object session.

TraversalStartTime.description: The start time of the record-capturing phase for the object session.
